newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.05 down at 42.00 to the dollar in the kerb market on Monday as the U.S. currency strengthened against most other currencies on world markets, dealers said.
The rupee is likely to open lower on Tuesday, dealer Owais Kalia of Khanani and Kalia International (pvt) Ltd said.
The State (central) bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 rupees to the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed unchanged at 4.80 percent. -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
